page.title: 19 FAVERSHAM CREEK CONTINUED
page.content: pleasure craft.The facilities at iron wharf,the building of east countryman barges by P.Winch,the small boat building and repair at the old shipyard and the new town jetty may mean more visiting small craft and more money spent in the town.Only 2 industries dominate today and both are involved in fertilizer and animal feed.Pauls have 1 vessel of 300 tons per month with soya & tapioca from Antwerp.Gilletts using 30 vessels p.a. also export grain to the continent.One mill is gloomy over future prospects especially if the channel tunnel is built.The other is optimistic & has installed a 500,000 pound computer system.The town seems to have turned its back on the creek in the past decade.There is little positive action and investment but it remains a tourist attraction.
